section.title: Verb patterns - gerund and infinitive
section.sectiontitle: When one verb follows another, the second is a gerund (-ing form) or an infinitive. There are no rules to say which verbs are followed by the infinitive or gerund.
section.text1a: I enjoy going to the cinema.
section.text2a: I want to go to the park.
section.sectiontitle2: Many verbs can use the pattern: verb + somebody + to + infinitive.
section.text3a: I helped her to pass the exam.
section.text4a: She reminded me to buy bread.

section.title: Verb patterns - gerund and infinitive
section.sectiontitle: Some verbs can be followed by both forms. Sometimes the meaning changes.
section.text1a: I stopped to drink some coffee. Then I continued my journey.
section.text2a: I stopped drinking coffee. I never drink it now.
